identificationModule.briefTitle: Bimanual Robotic Exoskeletal Platform for the Treatment of the Upper Limb in Patients With Stroke. A Feasibility Study
identificationModule.officialTitle: Pilot Study on the Evaluation of the Functionality, Safety and Feasibility of a Bimanual Robotic Exoskeletal Platform for the Treatment of the Upper Limb in Patients With Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The purpose of the study is to test the technical functionality, safety, and feasibility of a bimanual robotic exoskeletal platform and associated serious games in order to offer information on technological and functional advances that will be included in the device's finalization.

In addition, a secondary goal will be to assess the therapeutic effects of a rehabilitation therapy based on the bimanual configuration, comparing it to a unimanual treatment delivered on the same platform (using the specific configuration).

interventions.name: Robotic rehabilitation using the Arm Light Exoskeleton Rehab Station (ALEx RS) and bimanual serious games
interventions.description: Patients will undergo a bimanual 30-session robotic rehabilitation, using the robot ALEx RS with the bimanual configuration and the related serious games. Each session will last 45 minute. Daily sessions will be provided, five days a week.

interventions.name: Robotic rehabilitation using the Arm Light Exoskeleton Rehab Station (ALEx RS) and unimanual serious games
interventions.description: Patients will undergo a unimanual 30-session robotic rehabilitation, using the robot ALEx RS with the unimanual configuration and the related serious games.Daily sessions will be provided, five days a week.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Fugl-meyer Assessment Upper Extremity motor functioning
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a stroke-specific, performance-based impairment index. It ranges from 0 (hemiplegia) to 66 points (normal).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Fugl-meyer Assessment - Sensory functioning
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a stroke-specific, sensory impairment index. It ranges from 0 (worse) to 12points (best).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a validated measure of spasticity. It ranges from 0 (normal) to 4 (rigid limb).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Motricity Index for upper extremity
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a validated measure of upper limb strength. It ranges from 0 (worse) to 100 (normal strength).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Wolf Motor Function Test
secondaryOutcomes.description:
It is a validated measure of upper extremity motor ability through timed and functional tasks.

The scores ranges from 0 to 75; lower scores are indicative of lower functioning levels.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Action Research Arm Test (ARAT)
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a valid measure of upper-extremity functional limitation. The total score on the ARAT ranges from 0 to 57, with the lowest score indicating that no movements can be performed, and the upper score indicating normal performance.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Execution time (seconds) measured with the robot
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is the time (in seconds) required to perform reaching movement using the robot
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Range of Motion (degrees) measured with the robot
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is the range of motion (measured in degrees) of shoulder and elbow evaluated using the robot
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Number of velocity peaks measured with the robot
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is a measure of movement smoothness while performing reaching movements with the robot.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before the intervention, after a 6-week robotic rehabilitation intervention
